question: These display decision logic (IF statements) as a set of nodes (questions) and branches (answers).
A bundle is an activity or a function that is performed for some specific business reason.
A single fact, such as Order ID (sometimes called a data element), or a logical collection of several facts (e.g., new shop work order).
An external entity is a person, organization, organization unit, or system that is external to the system and never interacts with it.
All data stores must have at least one input data flow.
Use cases contain all the information needed to build one part of a process model.
Processes must be computerized.
Process models have just recently become a part of structured systems analysis and design techniques.
Experienced analysts usually draw a DFD perfectly the first time.
Models which provide information that is needed to ultimately build the system.
These represent complex policy decisions as rules that link various conditions with actions.
Data flows coming out of a data store indicate that information is retrieved from the data store.
There are two fundamentally different types of problems that can occur in DFDs: syntax errors and English errors.
Data flows going into a data store indicate that there is a logical error.
Semantics errors cause the fewest problems in system development.
Below the top-level DFD in the DFD hierarchy is the diagram called the what?
A collection of data that is stored in some way (which is determined later when creating the physical model).
Synchronizing means ensuring that all information presented in a DFD at one level is accurately represented in the next-level
This type of English uses short sentences to describe the work that a process performs.
The next level under level 1 would be labeled as level 2.
It is important to ensure that the level 0 and level 1 DFDs are balanced.
Use cases are the same as process diagrams.
The context diagram shows the entire system in context with its environment.
In general, syntax errors are easier to find and fix than are semantics errors.
We use data flow diagrams (DFDs) to describe the to-be system's interactions with its environment, processes, flows of data, and data stores.
The top-level DFD in every business process model, whether a manual system or a computerized system, is the what?
Iteration is the cornerstone of good DFD design.
Most business processes can be explained in one DFD.
The context diagram defines how the business process or computer system interacts with its Environment.
Process models rarely have level 1 diagrams.
The processes in the level 1 diagram are the _____ of the _____ process in the level 0 diagram.
There are no formal rules covering the layout of processes, data flows, data stores, and external entities within a DFD.
Every external entity has a name and a description.
Process descriptions provide additional information that the DFD does not provide.
The set of children and the parent are identical; they are simply different ways of looking at the same thing.
Models that describe processes, without suggesting how they are conducted.
Project teams usually draw process models by hand.
